intro: Huberantha forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' orchid, is a species of orchid native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it blooms during the spring and early summer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
